word: When Job heard the voice of the Lord out of the whirlwind, he exclaimed, \93I abhor myself, and repent in dust and ashes.\94 [Job 42:6.] It was when Isaiah saw the glory of the Lord, and heard the cherubim crying, \93Holy, holy, holy, is the Lord of hosts,\94 that he cried out, \93Woe is me! for I am undone.\94 [Isaiah 6:3, 5.] Paul, after he was caught up into the third heaven, and heard things which it was not possible for a man to utter, speaks of himself as \93less than the least of all saints.\94 [2 Corinthians 12:2-4 (MARGIN); Ephesians 3:8.] It was the beloved John, that leaned on Jesus\92 breast, and beheld his glory, who fell as one dead before the feet of the angel. [Revelation 22:8.]
